That should get you past the error message concerning street addresses in the .@fema application process.

You will get an error page, but it's okay. There will be a "Corrected Address" and a "Submitted Address."

DO NOT CLICK "RESUBMIT" under "Corrected Address"

Rather, click "Use Submitted" under "Submitted Address" http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DqkEWY2WkAAXGoV.jpg

When you start applying online at http://disasterassistance.gov, you will eventually get to the page where they ask about your street address. Here, you will enter:

LOT + # + street name spelled out + village name.

It is not case sensitive; all text entered is all caps. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DqkCqt1WwAA2Pz6.jpg
First, you must find your Lot Number. You can go to http://www.dpl.gov.mp/maps/ to find your lot number. Your lot number, village, and street name are what are important to retrieve here.

Many still have questions about how to enter their address when applying at http://disasterassistance.gov. .@FEMA requires a street address, but we have a system of lot numbers in the Marianas. So we'd like to walk you through the process in this thread.
